intro: Stimpsonia veronicoides, commonly known as the purple-stemmed veronicoid, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Stimpsonia veronicoides is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks.
